de.esoco.lib.expression

Class Predicates

  • java.lang.Object
    • de.esoco.lib.expression.Predicates

  • public class Predicates
extends java.lang.Object
    Contains factory methods that return standard predicates.

    • Nested Class Summary

      Nested Classes 
      Modifier and Type Class and Description
      static class  Predicates.And<T>
      Inner class for a logical AND between two predicates.
      static class  Predicates.Not<T>
      Implementation of the logical negation of a certain predicate.
      static class  Predicates.Or<T>
      Implementation of a logical OR between two predicates.

    • Method Detail

      • alwaysFalse

        public static <T> Predicate<T> alwaysFalse()
        Returns a predicate that will always yield FALSE.
        Returns:
        A predicate constant that always returns FALSE

      • alwaysTrue

        public static <T> Predicate<T> alwaysTrue()
        Returns a predicate that will always yield TRUE.
        Returns:
        A predicate constant that always returns TRUE

      • and

        public static <T> Predicate<T> and(Predicate<? super T> rFirst,
                                   Predicate<? super T> rSecond)
        Creates a new predicate that combines two other predicates with a logical and expression. The second predicate will only be evaluated if the first one evaluates as TRUE. Either of the two predicates can be NULL in which case the other predicate will be returned. This can be used to dynamically chain predicates without the need to check for NULL values. If both predicates are null NULL will be returned.
        Parameters:
        rFirst - The first predicate
        rSecond - The second predicate
        Returns:
        A new predicate combining the arguments with a logical and

      • chain

        public static <T,I> Predicate<T> chain(Predicate<I> rOuter,
                                       Function<T,? extends I> rInner)
        A specialized variant of Functions.chain(Function, Function) that creates a new predicate instead of a function. This allows to use the result of chaining a predicate with a function as a predicate again.
        Parameters:
        rOuter - The predicate that evaluates the inner function results
        rInner - The function that produces the predicate input values
        Returns:
        A new instance of PredicateChain

      • chain

        public static <L,R,V,W> BinaryPredicate<L,R> chain(BinaryPredicate<V,W> rOuter,
                                                   Function<L,? extends V> rLeft,
                                                   Function<R,? extends W> rRight)
        A specialized variant of Functions.chain(BinaryFunction, Function, Function) that creates a new binary predicate instead of a function. This allows to use the result of chaining a binary predicate with two functions as a predicate again.
        Parameters:
        rOuter - The predicate that evaluates the results of the left and right functions
        rLeft - The function that produces the left predicate input
        rRight - The function that produces the right predicate input
        Returns:
        A new instance of BinaryPredicateChain

      • countDown

        public static <T> Predicate<T> countDown(int nValue)
        Returns a new predicate instance that counts down from a certain value to zero and returns TRUE while the value is still greater and FALSE when it reached zero.
        Parameters:
        nValue - The value to count to zero from
        Returns:
        A new predicate instance

      • equalTo

        public static <T> Comparison<T,java.lang.Object> equalTo(java.lang.Object rValue)
        Returns a predicate that compares the target object with another object by means of the Object.equals(Object) method. The predicate yields TRUE if the tested object is equal to the other object. NULL values for both objects are allowed.
        Parameters:
        rValue - The value to compare the predicate targets with
        Returns:
        A new instance of the Comparison.EqualTo predicate

      • firstInChain

        public static Predicate<?> firstInChain(Predicate<?> rPredicate)
        A helper method that returns the first predicate that is not an instance of PredicateJoin. It is found by recursively traversing the tree of predicates by means of the method PredicateJoin.getLeft(). The first predicate that is not a join will be returned.
        Parameters:
        rPredicate - The predicate to start traversing the tree at
        Returns:
        The first non-join predicate

      • greaterOrEqual

        public static <T extends java.lang.Comparable<T>> Comparison<T,T> greaterOrEqual(T rValue)
        Returns a predicate that compares the target object with another object and yields TRUE if the tested object is greater than or equal to the other object.
        Parameters:
        rValue - The value to compare the predicate's argument with
        Returns:
        A new instance of the Comparison.GreaterOrEqual predicate

      • greaterThan

        public static <T extends java.lang.Comparable<T>> Comparison<T,T> greaterThan(T rValue)
        Returns a predicate that compares the target object with another object and yields TRUE if the tested object is greater than the other object.
        Parameters:
        rValue - The value to compare the predicate's argument with
        Returns:
        A new instance of the Comparison.GreaterThan predicate

      • hasBaseClass

        public static <T> ClassPredicate<T> hasBaseClass(java.lang.Class<?> rClass)
        Returns a class predicate that checks if target objects have a certain base class by means of the method Class.isAssignableFrom(Class).
        Parameters:
        rClass - The class to check target objects against
        Returns:
        A new instance of ClassPredicate.HasBaseClass

      • hasClass

        public static <T> ClassPredicate<T> hasClass(java.lang.Class<?> rClass)
        Returns a class predicate that checks if target objects have a certain class by performing an identity comparison of the classes.
        Parameters:
        rClass - The class to check target objects against
        Returns:
        A new instance of ClassPredicate.HasClass

      • hasFlag

        public static <R extends Relatable> Predicate<R> hasFlag(RelationType<java.lang.Boolean> rType)
        Returns a new predicate that invokes Relatable.hasFlag(RelationType).
        Parameters:
        rType - The boolean relation type to check
        Returns:
        A new predicate instance

      • hasRelation

        public static <R extends Relatable> Predicate<R> hasRelation(RelationType<?> rType)
        Returns a new predicate that checks if instances of Relatable have a certain relation set.
        Parameters:
        rType - The relation type to check
        Returns:
        A new predicate instance

      • ifField

        public static <T,V> ElementPredicate<T,V> ifField(java.lang.String sField,
                                                  Predicate<V> rPredicate)
        Creates an ElementPredicate for a certain field in target objects. It creates an instance of the function GetElement.ReadField to retrieve the field value from target objects.

        Attention: if the generic value type (V) that is defined by the predicate is not of type Object the field value will be cast to that type at runtime. If the types do not match a ClassCastException will be thrown when evaluating the predicate.

        Parameters:
        sField - The name of the field to evaluate the value of
        rPredicate - The predicate to evaluate the field value with
        Returns:
        A new instance of ElementPredicate for field access

      • ifProperty

        public static <T,V> ElementPredicate<T,V> ifProperty(java.lang.String sProperty,
                                                     Predicate<V> rPredicate)
        Creates an ElementPredicate for a certain property in target objects. It creates an instance of the function GetElement.GetField to retrieve the property value from target objects.

        Attention: if the generic value type (V) that is defined by the predicate is not of type Object the property value will be cast to that type at runtime. If the types do not match a ClassCastException will be thrown when evaluating the predicate.

        Parameters:
        sProperty - The name of the property to evaluate the value of
        rPredicate - The predicate to evaluate the field value with
        Returns:
        A new instance of ElementPredicate for field access

      • ifProperty

        public static <T extends Relatable,V> Predicate<T> ifProperty(RelationType<V> rType,
                                                              Predicate<? super V> rPredicate)
        Creates an ElementPredicate to evaluate a predicate on a certain property relation in related objects. This is just a property-specific name for the method ifRelation(RelationType, Predicate).
        See Also:
        ifRelation(RelationType, Predicate)

      • ifRelation

        public static <T extends Relatable,V> ElementPredicate<T,V> ifRelation(RelationType<V> rType,
                                                                       Predicate<? super V> rPredicate)
        Creates an ElementPredicate to evaluate a predicate on a certain relation in related objects.
        Parameters:
        rType - The relation type to evaluate the target value of
        rPredicate - The predicate to evaluate the field value with
        Returns:
        A new instance of ElementPredicate for relation access

      • isFirstCall

        public static <T> Predicate<T> isFirstCall()
        Returns a new predicate that evaluates to TRUE on the first invocation only, independent of the target object. All further evaluations will yield FALSE.
        Returns:
        A new predicate that yields TRUE only on the first evaluation

      • isNull

        public static <T> Predicate<T> isNull()
        Returns a predicate that tests if the target object is NULL.
        Returns:
        A constant predicate that yields TRUE if the target object is NULL

        Parameters:
        rValue - The value to compare the predicate's argument with
        Returns:
        A new instance of the Comparison.LessOrEqual predicate

        Parameters:
        rValue - The value to compare the predicate's argument with
        Returns:

        Parameters:
        sRegularExpression - The regular expression pattern string
        Returns:
        A new instance of the Comparison.Matching predicate

        Parameters:

        Returns:

      • modified

        public static <R extends Relatable> Predicate<R> modified()
        Returns a predicate that tests if the MetaTypes.MODIFIED flag is set on a relatable object.
        Returns:
        A constant predicate that yields TRUE if the target object is marked as modified

        public static <T> Predicate<T> not(Predicate<T> rPredicate)
        Returns the logical negation of a particular predicate.
        Parameters:
        rPredicate - The predicate to negate
        Returns:
        A new predicate with a logical NOT expression

      • notModified

        public static <R extends Relatable> Predicate<R> notModified()
        Returns a predicate that tests if the MetaTypes.MODIFIED flag is not set on a relatable object.
        Returns:
        A constant predicate that yields TRUE if the target object is not marked as modified

      • notNull

        public static <T> Predicate<T> notNull()
        Returns a predicate that tests if the target object is not null.
        Returns:
        A predicate constant that returns TRUE if the target object is not NULL

      • or

        public static <T> Predicate<T> or(Predicate<? super T> rFirst,
                                  Predicate<? super T> rSecond)
        Creates a new predicate that combines two other predicates with a logical or expression. The second predicate will only be evaluated if the first one evaluates as FALSE. Either of the two predicates can be NULL in which case the other predicate will be returned. This can be used to dynamically chain predicates without the need to check for NULL values. If both predicates are null NULL will be returned.
        Parameters:
        rFirst - The first predicate
        rSecond - The second predicate
        Returns:
        A new predicate combining the arguments with a logical or

      • sameAs

        public static <T> Comparison<T,java.lang.Object> sameAs(java.lang.Object rValue)
        Returns a predicate that compares the target object with another object by means of the comparison operator ('=='). The predicate yields TRUE if the tested object is identical to the other object. NULL values for both objects are allowed.
        Parameters:
        rValue - The value to compare the predicate targets with
        Returns:
        A new instance of the Comparison.SameAs predicate

      • unchecked

        public static <T,E extends java.lang.Exception> Predicate<T> unchecked(Predicate.ThrowingPredicate<T,E> pChecked)
        Takes a predicate that throws an exception and returns it as a predicate that can be executed without a checked exception. This method is mainly intended to be used with lambdas that throw exceptions.
        Parameters:
        pChecked - The checked predicate to wrap as unchecked
        Returns:
        The unchecked predicate

      • unchecked

        public static <L,R,E extends java.lang.Exception> BinaryPredicate<L,R> unchecked(BinaryPredicate.ThrowingBinaryPredicate<L,R,E> pChecked)
        Takes a binary predicate that throws an exception and returns it as a binary predicate that can be executed without a checked exception. This method is mainly intended to be used with lambdas that throw exceptions.
        Parameters:
        pChecked - The checked predicate to wrap as unchecked
        Returns:
        The unchecked predicate

      • when

        public static <I,O,T extends I> Predicate<T> when(Function<I,O> rFunction,
                                                  Predicate<? super O> rPredicate)
        Returns a new instance of FunctionPredicate that evaluates the result of applying a function to input objects with a predicate.
        Parameters:
        rFunction - The function to apply to input values
        rPredicate - The predicate to evaluate the function result with
        Returns:
        A new predicate
